snippet: Unions’ get-out-the-vote efforts face a daunting challenge: Conservative “super PACs” with unlimited donations have saturated Ohio and other crucial states with anti-Obama ads.
abstract: Unions’ get-out-the-vote efforts face a daunting challenge combating conservative super PACs, who have used unlimited donations from corporations and wealthy individuals to saturate Ohio and other crucial states with anti-Obama ads.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and STEVEN GREENHOUSE
byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Columbus, and Steven Greenhouse from New York.

lead_paragraph: Unions’ get-out-the-vote efforts face a daunting challenge: Conservative “super PACs” with unlimited donations have saturated Ohio and other crucial states with anti-Obama ads.

headline.seo: Ohio Unions Face Tough Battle With ‘Super PACs’
headline.main: Ohio Unions Battle Conservative ‘Super PACs’ for Votes
headline.print_headline: Flood of Conservative Money Challenges Ohio Unions’ Voter Drives

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
